metadata.title: CVE-2022-3266 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds read can occur when decoding H264 video. This results in apotentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR <102.3, Thunderbird < 102.3, and Firefox < 105.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3266` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 105.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 105.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 105.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '105.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
